original_solution_mapping.L1: To make 200 fries he will need 200 / 25 fries per potato = <<200/25=8>>8 potatoes.
original_solution_mapping.L2: He has 15 potatoes - 8 potatoes = <<15-8=7>>7 leftover potatoes.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7314.
    Returns: the number of potatoes the chef will have leftover.
    """
    # L1
    fries_needed = 200 # he needs 200 fries
    fries_per_potato = 25 # He can get 25 fries out of 1 potato
    potatoes_needed = fries_needed / fries_per_potato

    # L2
    potatoes_on_hand = 15 # He has 15 potatoes
    leftover_potatoes = potatoes_on_hand - potatoes_needed

    # FA
    answer = leftover_potatoes
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: To make {fries_needed} fries he will need {fries_needed} / {fries_per_potato} fries per potato = <<{fries_needed}/{fries_per_potato}={potatoes_needed}>>{potatoes_needed} potatoes.
He has {potatoes_on_hand} potatoes - {potatoes_needed} potatoes = <<{potatoes_on_hand}-{potatoes_needed}={leftover_potatoes}>>{leftover_potatoes} leftover potatoes.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: To make 25 fries he will need 25 / 25 fries per potato = <<25/25=1>>1 potatoes.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: He has 15 potatoes - 1 potatoes = <<15-1=14>>14 leftover potatoes.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'fries_per_potato' (25) was used instead of 'fries_needed' (200).
